official-title.#text: To establish the conditions under which the Secretary of Homeland Security may establish preclearance facilities, conduct preclearance operations, and provide customs services outside the United States, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives July 8, 2014.

text.#text: In this Act, the term

may establish
preclearance operations in a foreign country to—

text.#text: Pursuant to
prevent terrorists, instruments of terrorism, and other security threats from entering the United States;
prevent inadmissible persons from entering the United States;
ensure merchandise destined for the United States complies with applicable laws;
ensure the prompt processing of persons eligible to travel to the United States; and
accomplish such other objectives as the Secretary determines necessary to protect the United States.

A homeland security threat assessment for the country in which such preclearance operations are to be established.

Information on potential security vulnerabilities associated with commencing such preclearance operations, and mitigation plans to address such potential security vulnerabilities.

text.#text: In the case of an airport, in addition to the notification requirements under

header.#text: Certifications relating to preclearance operations established at airports

text.#text: A certification that preclearance operations under such preclearance agreement would provide homeland security benefits to the United States.
A certification that preclearance operations within such foreign country will be established under such agreement only if—
at least one United States passenger carrier operates at such airport; and
the access of all United States passenger carriers to such preclearance operations is the same as the access of any non-United States passenger carrier.

A certification that the establishment of preclearance operations in such foreign country will not significantly increase customs processing times at United States airports.
An explanation of other objectives that will be served by the establishment of preclearance operations in such foreign country.

text.#text: Not later than 30 days before substantially modifying a preclearance agreement with the government of a foreign country in effect as of the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall monthly measure the average customs processing time to enter the 25 United States airports that support the highest volume of international travel (as determined by available Federal passenger data) and provide to the appropriate congressional committees such measurements.

header.#text: Aviation security screening at preclearance airports
